function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Weakening of multilateral institutions, including the WHO, by influential developed countries.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Weak public health systems unable to manage population-wide approaches","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on imports for vital equipment","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of prioritization of public health and wellbeing in economic systems","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Weaknesses and disparities in healthcare systems","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Promotion of private sector models for healthcare in low-and middle-income countries","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduction in public social expenditures","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rising inequality and falling labor shares of income","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Privatization of essential natural monopolies","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increase in global inequality due to the pandemic","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exposure of vulnerabilities caused by neoliberalism","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unequal impact of COVID-19 on different social classes, genders, and age groups","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Food insecurity and famine due to lockdowns and other crises","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Restriction of movement for essential medical personnel and supplies","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on digital technologies for epidemic monitoring and control","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High-speed network reliance for tracking strategic locations and infected patients","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Industry 4.0 and Medicine 4.0 adoption","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Governments failing to prepare for the magnitude of the COVID-19 pandemic","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unprecedented demand for critical resources","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Need for innovative and emerging technologies to combat the pandemic","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid spread of SARS CoV-2 infection","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Surge demands for critical care facilities","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to provide protective gear and medical supplies","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Financial strain preventing industries from investing in IoT","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on IoT for operational continuity during pandemics or emergencies","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overworked hospital staff and overburdened facilities due to COVID-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased reliance on remote collaboration and control in industrial IoT may lead to greater spread of contagious diseases if not managed effectively","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate adoption of digital maintenance and automation in response to pandemics may result in operational disruptions and increased risk of disease transmission","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of preparedness in identifying and mitigating potential equipment failures through digital twin technology may lead to increased risk of disease transmission and productivity losses","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Changes in travel patterns and behaviors due to COVID-19 may increase the risk of spreading contagious diseases in transportation networks","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of seamless integration of data from different sources may result in inaccurate or unreliable information being shared with travelers","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inefficiency and delays in logistics could lead to hoarding of supplies, social contact, and increased risk of exposure to contagious diseases during supply chain operations","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of data integration and data security could lead to compromised access control, potentially risking sensitive information","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased reliance on online services may lead to a reduced physical presence in brick-and-mortar stores, potentially impacting public health and safety","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of integration and analysis of customer behavior data may limit the effectiveness of AI, IoT, and big data solutions in the retail and entertainment industry","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of effective indoor navigation leading to increased contact with other people","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate cleaning due to lack of understanding of indoor mobility data","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient integration of data leading to ineffective deployment of context-aware devices","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Shift in energy consumption from commercial buildings to homes due to COVID-19 lifestyle changes","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Smart buildings and robots must grasp spatial indoor topology, semantics, and dynamic information to serve people effectively","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unwillingness or inability to invest in specialized medical devices or wearables","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on expensive research-grade wearable devices","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Obstacles in smart home IoT adoption due to cost and technical skills requirement","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Wearable technology not optimized for different groups with different lifestyles and circumstances, leading to discomfort and potential health issues","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited computational and memory resources for model training and deployment on IoT devices, affecting the quality of healthcare AI algorithms","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of energy-efficient wearable technology leading to rapid battery drainage and reduced usability","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decentralized data pools at personal devices may lead to privacy concerns and unauthorized data access","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low threshold healthcare IoT services may lead to inaccurate or unreliable medical data","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Energy requirements and computational efficiency challenges in healthcare sensors may lead to unreliable monitoring and testing/diagnosis","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of cheap and easy-to-install IoT sensors and devices","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
